speaker: Skyline
text: Doppler Waves emanate from the top of the Space Needle._   [_Scene 1 - Frasier's apartment. Eddie is sprawled lethargically on Martin's chair.  Martin and Daphne enter from the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, gosh...What did I just find in my pocket?  Is that tri-tip with peanut butter?  [_He moves to the couch and holds a bag in front of Eddie._] It is! [_Eddie does not respond._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hmm, no luck?  He's definitely coming down with something.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess I'm going to have to eat these myself.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good idea.  Reverse psychology!

speaker: Martin
text: [_munching on the food_] What do you mean?  [_Frasier enters from the direction of his room, followed by a maintenance man._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Joe has found the source of the leak in my ceiling.  It is Cam Winston's brand new washing machine!  By God, for this time he's gone too far!  As if his noise and noxious presence at the condo board meetings weren't bad enough.  Have you ever heard of anything more..._fury inspiring!_

speaker: Daphne
text: I certainly have not.  Imagine the cheek of the man, installing an illegal washer-dryer.

speaker: Joe
text: Oh, they're not illegal.  A lot of the units have them.  You guys have a hookup in the hall closet where you keep all those hats...  [_The look on Daphne's face at this revelation shows that she has found something more "fury-inspiring" than Frasier's issues with Cam._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quickly, to Daphne_] First of all, I had completely forgotten about the hookup.  Second of all, I believe the homburg is poised for a comeback, and third, we have a more immediate problem, in the form of the evil waters of Cam Winston!

speaker: Joe
text: Yeah, about that, maybe you could ask Mr. Winston to not use the machine till we get that leak patched.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wrong!  We've got to teach Cam a lesson and shut his water off right now!

speaker: Joe
text: That's, uh, not our standard operating procedure.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reaching for his pocket_] Well, I could compensate you for your pains.

speaker: Joe
text: I gotta go all the way to the basement...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_handing him some bills_] Perhaps this will help persuade you?

speaker: Joe
text: This might get me as far as six.  [_Frasier counts out more bills and hands them to Joe.  The doorbell rings.  Niles rushes in on a fancy motorized pedestrian vehicle.  He is wearing a billed cap._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all. [_Daphne looks curious and excited about the machine._] It's called a Segway.  My friend Raul at the university is doing an experiment on the psychological effects of technology, and he asked me to ride it around.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, how do you like it?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, walking is but a distant memory!  Better yet, I can redirect the unused energy to other pursuits [_scooting near Daphne_] like playing Squash... or lovemaking.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh... Niles! [_They kiss._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I'd love to stay and gawk, but I'm at war!  Come, Joe.  [_Frasier and Joe exit.  Niles scoots around the back of the couch._]

speaker: Niles
text: What was that about?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Cam Winston.  Hey, can I get a ride on that thing?

speaker: Niles
text: Nothing would please me more. [_Scoots up to Martin_] But, no. [_He scoots past him._] One of the conditions of the experiment is that I can't share the Segway with anyone - not even you, Daphne, I'm sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't believe you agreed to that!

speaker: Niles
text: [_insincerely_] Well, it was damn difficult, let me tell you.  But I'll make a note of your disappointment in my daily write-up.  [_Niles continues to scoot and gyrate around the room.  The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I know we can't ride it, but there's a poor, sick little dog here...

speaker: Niles
text: [_interrupting_] Dad, again, saying "no" is one of the prices we all pay for science.  Now, who wants a Fudgesicle? [_He scoots toward the kitchen._]  [_Daphne answers the door to reveal Cam Winston, who is damp and wearing a bathrobe._]

speaker: Cam
text: [_haughtily_] Good afternoon.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Mr. Winston.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Cam, come on in!

speaker: Cam
text: [_entering_] Is Frasier at home?  Someone has shut off my water, and I suspect his hand is at the spigot.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez, that doesn't sound like Fras.

speaker: Cam
text: Then you don't know what he's capable of. [_notices Eddie_] What's the matter with your dog?  He looks a little glassy-eyed.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he's got a bug.  I've got to take him to the vet.

speaker: Cam
text: Well, my mother's a vet, and she happens to be staying with me. I'm sure she wouldn't mind taking a look... even if it is Frasier's dog. [_He moves toward Martin and Eddie._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, he's mine.  Frasier can't stand him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, when he's healthy he jumps on Dr. Crane's bed, drools on his pillow, chews on his slippers...

speaker: Cam
text: [_suddenly pleased_] Really?  We've got to get this little rascal back up on his feet!  [_He and Martin laugh as he pets Eddie.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment. Martin is lying on the couch, playing with Eddie, who is obviously back to normal.  Daphne enters, carrying a basket of laundry from the direction of her room._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I've done some calculating, and in the last nine years, I've carried 2.8 tons of laundry approximately 106.4 miles back and forth to the basement.  That's the same as carrying an SUV on my back to Canada!

speaker: Martin
text: [_sprawled on the couch petting and feeding Eddie_] Maybe we should ask him to buy a washer-dryer.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastically_] Oh, there's an idea!  I was going to suggest moving the apartment closer to the laundry room. [_She opens the door as Cam's mother is about to knock._] Hello, Dr. Winston.  [_Cam's mother is an attractive African-American woman in her early 60's. She enters._]

speaker: Cora
text: Hello, Daphne.  Martin.  I just came by to check on my patient.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he's much better.  I'm off to do the laundry.

speaker: Cora
text: You don't have your own here?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_pausing_] No.  We have a hat museum.  [_She exits with the laundry._]

speaker: Cora
text: [_approaching the couch_] How's our boy?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh he's doing great!  Those antibiotics workes wonders.  How about a cup of coffee?

speaker: Cora
text: Thanks.  Cream, no sugar.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay. [_He goes to prepare the coffee._]

speaker: Cora
text: [_examining Eddie_] He looks good!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Eddie's tough.  Plus the smartest dog ever!

speaker: Cora
text: I always thought Border Collies were the smartest dogs.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughing with mock disdain_] Well, it's obvious you haven't had much exposure to dogs.  What were you, a zoo doctor? [_He returns with the coffee._]

speaker: Cora
text: No, I just treat pets...and their owners' egos.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, tell me!  Cat people.  Well, it's really handy having a vet right here in the building.

speaker: Cora
text: Well, it's only temporary.  They're doing some remodeling on my house.  It was only supposed to take a few weeks... then Cam found out.  Suddenly I'm getting new bay windows and a kitchen based on something he saw in English Home Magazine.  You have no idea.

speaker: Martin
text: No, unfortunately, I do.  [_Frasier enters from his room._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Dad.  Oh, Dr. Winston.

speaker: Cora
text: Hello, Frasier.  Martin, I've got to be going.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well thanks for stopping by to see Eddie.

speaker: Cora
text: It was no problem.  Oh, Frasier, I almost forgot.  This is for you from Cam.  [_She hands Martin an envelope which she was holding when she entered. Martin passes it to Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, thank you, Dr. Winston.  Nice seeing you again.  [_Martin and Cora approach the door and exchange goodbyes.  Cora exits._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_suspicious_] What was that about?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she just came by to see Eddie.  Kind of a medical-slash- social visit. [_He moves to his chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Social!  Dear God, don't tell me that you and that _scoundrel's_ mother...

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Frasier, take it easy.  We just had a cup of coffee.  [_Frasier opens the envelope and reads the paper inside.  He gives a scornful laugh._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all the pieces suddenly fit. [_He sits at the table._]

speaker: Martin
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a bill from Cam.  Apparently turning off his water has ruined the clothes that were in his washing machine.  Those clothes were already ruined just by being on Cam Winston!

speaker: Martin
text: [_reacting to Frasier's childishness_] Well, then don't pay him. Have another fight.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] The battle is joined.  I will not let that--that Mata Hari drag you into this.  From this day forward, no more Winstons in this, my house!  [_Frasier exits toward his room in a huff.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 3 - The lobby of Frasier's building. Martin is checking the mail.  Cora approaches._]

speaker: Cora
text: Hey, Marty!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, Cora!  [_She approaches him and bends to pet Eddie._]

speaker: Martin
text: Ooh, be careful.  If Frasier catches you petting Eddie, it'll be the pound for him.

speaker: Cora
text: Cam actually forbade me from coming to your apartment.  And they're so alike you'd think they'd get along.  [_Martin laughs.  Cam crosses the hall to the elevator.  Martin sees him._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Cam.

speaker: Cam
text: Good afternoon, Mr. Crane. [_The elevator opens._] Come along mother. [_singsong_] I've already checked the mail.  [_He is very uncomfortable._]

speaker: Cora
text: I'll be up in a minute!  Don't worry.

speaker: Cam
text: Very well. [_He pauses, unsure of what to do or say._] Carry on.  [_He enters the elevator, which closes.  He continues to display an uncomfortable, indignant look on his face._]

speaker: Cora
text: I can't believe that's my son!  What has gotten into him?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, why would they want to drag us into their feud?

speaker: Cora
text: I think it's because if we're friends, then they at least have to try to be nice.

speaker: Martin
text: You know what, we should get married.  Really make them suffer.

speaker: Cora
text: [_laughing_] Oh, my!  It'd be worth it just to see the looks on their faces!  [_They laugh, obviously enjoying each other's company as well as making fun of their sons.  Frasier enters, witnessing the laughter from behind._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Winston.  I see you've checked the mail already.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, here you go.  [_Frasier takes the mail.  Martin waves.  Frasier moves to the elevator and nods for Martin to join him at the elevator.  He repeats this gesture. The elevator opens.  As Frasier enters, Martin and Cora have their backs turned to him. Martin, seized with a sudden inspiration, slips his hand into Cora's. The elevator closes on Frasier, who has a look of utter horror on his face.  Martin and Cora double over with laughter.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT 1  ACT 2_  [_Scene 4 - Cam's apartment. The layout is exactly the same as Frasier's, and the decor is tastefully eclectic, emphasizing how similar Cam and Frasier really are.  Cora, wearing a long pink dressing gown, opens the door to reveal Martin, who is wearing the robe we have seen many times before._]

speaker: Cora
text: [_whispering_] Good morning.

speaker: Martin
text: Good morning.  Is he still asleep?

speaker: Cora
text: I just heard his alarm so we have to hurry. [_they rush to the dining area_]

speaker: Martin
text: I can't believe we're doing this.  It's so mean!

speaker: Cora
text: I know.  Isn't it great?  [_As they run offstage, Cam enters the living room in a fashionable dressing gown.  He opens the door to get his newspaper, and turns to see Cora and Martin entering from the opposite hallway._]

speaker: Cora
text: Good morning, Sweetheart!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hello, Cam.  [_Cam stares in a stupor of disbelief.  Cora goes into the kitchen as Martin sits at the dinner table._]

speaker: Cam
text: Hi...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, flip you for the sports page!  Oh, I don't have a quarter. I'll just get my pants.  [_He gestures toward the back of the apartment and starts to rise. Cam immediately hands him the whole paper._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks, buddy!

speaker: Cora
text: [_sticks her head out_] Can I fix you some breakfast, baby?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, just toast and coffee.

speaker: Cora
text: [_suggestively_] I was talking to Cam!

speaker: Martin
text: [_chuckling with feigned embarassment_] Oh... whoops.

speaker: Cam
text: [_stonefaced_] You know, actually, I'm not that hungry.  I'll... get something on the way to work.  [_Cam turns, knocking one of his knicknacks off a shelf and nervously catching it.  He exits to the rear.  Martin hurriedly stands up._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_toward the kitchen_] Psst!

speaker: Cora
text: [_entering_] That was perfect!

speaker: Martin
text: You don't think we went to far, do you?

speaker: Cora
text: Not yet.  [_They hurriedly exit._]  [_Scene 5 - Quick dissolve to Frasier's apartment, which as we know is directly below Cam's.  Martin and Cora hurriedly enter.  They rush to the dining table, as Frasier is heard in the background bellowing "Daphne!" with anguish._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!  Daphne!  Daphne!!  [_He runs into the living room wearing pajamas and stops short at the sight of Martin and Cora, who is looking at a newspaper. He grins stupidly._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Winston!

speaker: Martin
text: Morning!

speaker: Cora
text: Morning.  [_Throughout the scene, Frasier enunciates in a strained voice, concealing a combination of nervousness, embarrassment, and seething anger._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Good morning.  How did this... How did you... sleep?

speaker: Martin
text: [_grinning widely_] Like a couple of logs.

speaker: Cora
text: More like two baby kittens curled up in a tight fuzzy ball.  [_Martin laughs with feigned embarassment.  Frasier looks like he is about to explode._]

speaker: Martin
text: God, you're cute!  Isn't she, Frasier?

speaker: Cora
text: [_notices time_] Oh dear, I should probably go.

speaker: Martin
text: Aww...

speaker: Cora
text: Bye, Sweetie.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye, Sweetheart.  [_They kiss briefly on the lips._]

speaker: Cora
text: Bye, Frasier.  [_She goes toward the door, followed by Martin._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good-bye.  Nice to see you.  [_Cora exits, Martin closes the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell is going on?!

speaker: Martin
text: What does it look like?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, are you crazy?  She's a Winston!  She's probably just leading you on so she can break your heart!  That's exactly the kind of thing Cam would do to hurt me.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, you know, I finally find a woman I like, and who seems to like me, and all you can think about is your stupid feud.  [_Frasier retreats, but tries another tack._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just a little surprised.  I didn't realize things were going so fast.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, then it's a good thing you found out, because things could get more serious--a lot more serious.

speaker: Frasier
text: What does that mean?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, let's just say, I wouldn't mind having a stepson.  [_Martin exits to the hall, leaving Frasier gaping with horror._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_recovering_] Dad, now you're just provoking me, aren't you? [_calling after him_] Dad?  Dad!  Are you?  [_Daphne enters from her room._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Good morning, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_seething_] Theeeere you are.  [_He holds up a dark sock._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What is the meaning of _this_?  Where is his mate?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry.  I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: Frasier
text: My favorite pair of socks reduced to a single argyle!  Nor is this the only example.  The keen observer yesterday would have noticed that I left the apartment wearing _two shades_ of black!  Explanation, please!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, Dr. Crane.  I'm forced to do the laundry downstairs, and I guess your socks are just too tempting to the neighbors. Of course, you're welcome to go down there yourself and stand guard.  [_Frasier nods in indignation during this speech._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  But if we had our own washer-dryer, there would be no more lost socks. [_seething_] I will not be strong- armed by threats against my laundry!

speaker: Daphne
text: Suit yourself.  I'm off to do a load of your pinks.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't have any pinks.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_exiting to the kitchen_] You will.  [_Frasier has a mortified and defeated look on his face.  Fade out._]  **SPEAKING OF SEGWAYS...**  [_Scene 6 - Cafe Nervosa. Fade in over the opening lines.  Roz and Frasier are sitting together._]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with repressed agitation_] I'm fine.

speaker: Roz
text: You seem like you've been in a lousy mood lately.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just that they put soy milk in my latte.  I don't like soy milk.  If it doesn't come from a teat or an udder, it isn't milk. [_looks out the window_] Oh, terrific.  Here comes Niles on his fabulous "showing up Frasier" contraption. All he wants is attention, so don't give him any!  [_Niles cruises toward them on the Segway, still wearing the cap. Frasier looks away, while Roz and everyone else points and chatters in excitement._]

speaker: Niles
text: Greetings, foot people!  How are things back in the 20th Century?

speaker: Roz
text: [_rising_] Wow!  That looks like fun!

speaker: Niles
text: Fun?  Well, I suppose it is.  I never really thought about it.  You see, the Segway is more of a productivity tool.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you think I could...

speaker: Niles
text: [_interrupting_] No, go away. [_He cruises away from them._]

speaker: Roz
text: It's not the only tool.  [_The waiter hands Niles a coffee.  This is the same waiter that Frasier was unable to stymie in the previous episode, "Deathtrap"[[9.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_19/deathtrap.html "Deathtrap")._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I haven't ordered yet.

speaker: Waiter
text: It's on the house.  We love the machine.  [_A crowd of onlookers looks admiringly at Niles.  Frasier shakes his head in disgust._]

speaker: Niles
text: That is sooo nice!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I think I've seen just about enough.  Free food and drink, just because you showed them something new.  I'll tell you what.  Let's all paint our bottoms and run to the sandwich shop!

speaker: Niles
text: My, my, feelings of inadequacy... typical reaction from the unwheeled.  I'll make a note of your grumpiness.

speaker: Frasier
text: If I'm grumpy, it's because of Cam Winston.  Do you realize that Dad and Cam's mother are dating?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I do and I think it's great.  Honestly, Frasier, you have to loosen up. [_enunciating to everybody as he cruises away_] Openness to new ideas is the hallmark of our new century!  [_As he exits, the crowd erupts in applause.  Roz and Frasier look at each other with disgust._]

speaker: Roz
text: Don't you hope he gets hit by a car?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm... Excuse me, can I please get another cup of coffee?  No soy milk this time.  [_He hands his cup to the waiter._]

speaker: Roz
text: So that's what's bugging you.  Your dad has a new girlfriend.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm just afraid he's going to get hurt.

speaker: Roz
text: No you're not, you're afraid you're going to have to be nice to Cam.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am nice!  Cam's insufferable.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, fine, whatever,here's what I'd do.  Be the first one to make peace.  Then you'll be the bigger man to your dad and to his girlfriend, and it'll drive Cam nuts.  [_Frasier's cell phone rings._]

speaker: Frasier
text: That's good, Roz.  Seize the high ground.  You know, I'll offer Cam an apology and he'll be trumped. [_He chuckles as he answers his phone._] Hello?  Cam!  I was just about to call _you_.  A truce, you say?  I'm sorry, I can't hear you.  You're break... up!  I'm afraid my bat... is low on pow-  [_He quickly cuts off the line and folds up the phone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Son of a bitch is trying to steal my high ground!  [_Fade out._]  [_Scene 7 - Cam's apartment. Cam opens the door to Frasier._]

speaker: Cam
text: Hello, Crane.  Glad you could make it... I guess.

speaker: Frasier
text: Spare me your honey-glazed pleasantries, Cam.  I am here to roll up my sleeves and end our feud.

speaker: Cam
text: As am I.  That's why I called you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just for the record, it was my idea to apologize first.

speaker: Cam
text: Well, that seems appropriate, since you're the one who shut off the water and ruined my clothes.

speaker: Frasier
text: That, sir, is a fraction of the story.  Since you moved into this building, you have encroached upon my parking space, you have undermined my position with the condo board, and you killed a magnificent Virginia Creeper.

speaker: Cam
text: Which you gleefully encouraged to climb the balcony and choke my dangling ivy!

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought it was marijuana!

speaker: Cam
text: Dangling ivy looks nothing like marijuana!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure I wouldn't know.  [_With that, he turns away as if he's just scored a point._]

speaker: Cam
text: This is getting us nowhere, Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_relenting_] Agreed, agreed.  I guess we'll never really see eye to eye, but I am resolved to put aside our differences for the sake of our parents.  [_Cam has produced a bottle of sherry and two glasses._]

speaker: Cam
text: For the sake of our parents.  Where are they anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Downstairs watching _Court TV_.

speaker: Cam
text: Ah.  It's all about romance with you Cranes, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, you see, there you go again.  I lower my guard and you slap me in the face.

speaker: Cam
text: All right, I apologize.  And as a token of my sincerity, I pledge to pay whatever damage my washer-dryer may have caused.  [_Cam offers Frasier a glass._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well done.  And in the same spirit of hatchet-burying, I agree to pay for your ruined clothes. Cheers.  [_They toast, then Frasier offers his hand.  Cam starts to take it, but pulls it away._]

speaker: Cam
text: Since things seem to be off on such a good foot, perhaps now is a good time to discuss the mailbox situation.

speaker: Frasier
text: You want to switch, don't you?

speaker: Cam
text: As a tall man, I dislike having to stoop for my mail.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed.  Well, I would prefer to put aside that explosive issue until we're sure the truce will hold.

speaker: Cam
text: I see.  Fair enough.  [_Cam offers his hand.  Frasier starts to take it, but pulls it away._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Unless you're willing to agree on some sort of noise abatement framework.  You see, you have a unique sliding gait, Cam.  When you wear your heeled boots, the resultant shh-clop, shh-clop, shh-clop... well, it just sounds like a dancing pony in my apartment.

speaker: Cam
text: Perhaps we should get some paper so we can write all this down.  [_As Frasier nods in agreement, and Cam puts down his glass, we dissolve to:_]  [_Scene 8 - Time fade. Frasier and Cam are now seated.  The sherry bottle sits nearly empty on the coffee table, surrounded by seven or eight pieces of crinkled yellow paper.  Cam and Frasier are seated on the couch with their sherries, as Cam finishes writing on the tablet that was the source of the yellow paper._]

speaker: Cam
text: Fine.  I will arrange an introduction to my sweater weaver.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good.  Thank you.

speaker: Cam
text: But, then I must insist on the formula to your bath blend.  [_Frasier looks concerned.  He pauses and takes a drink._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I think we were closer on an earlier draft.

speaker: Cam
text: Concur.  [_They begin to straighten the crinkled pages, looking for the more promising earlier draft.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 9 - Frasier's apartment. Martin, Cora, and Daphne are seated at the dining table drinking coffee.  Niles is still on his Segway, also drinking coffee._]

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Niles.  That Truffaut film you like is playing down at the La Salle.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  Sounds tempting.  But the people behind me wouldn't be able to see.

speaker: Daphne
text: I guess we'll stay in, then. [_gets up_] I'm going to go take a bath. It's too bad you have to stay on that. [_seductively_] I could use a third, and a fourth hand.  [_She cranes upward to give him a teasing kiss, then walks toward her room.  Niles spins around, following her with his eyes and whining softly._]

speaker: Niles
text: Uh... wait!  Daphne, Daphne, Daphne...  [_He parks the Segway and finally dismounts._]

speaker: Niles
text: There we go.  You wait there, I'll light the candles.  [_He runs off, passing Daphne, who waits for him to exit._]

speaker: Daphne
text: So long, sucker!  [_Martin and Cora laugh as she runs over and jumps onto the Segway._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_running back_] Daphne, what are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Whoo!  Hold the door!  [_She cruises to the door, where Cam and Frasier have just entered. They make room for her._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Whoo-hoo!  Whoa-hoh!

speaker: Niles
text: [_running after her, distressed_] Daphne!  Daphne...  [_They exit, Niles in desperate pursuit.  Frasier and Cam exchange a look and close the door._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, boys!

speaker: Cora
text: Have you two been fighting?

speaker: Frasier
text: On the contrary.  Cam and I are here to announce the cessation of all hostilities between us.  We are officially friends.

speaker: Cam
text: As defined by the treaty. [_They shake hands._]

speaker: Cora
text: Well, that means a lot to us.

speaker: Cam
text: Oh, I think it's safe to say that we've entered a whole new era of coopera...  [_He catches himself, noticing one of Frasier's knick-knacks._]

speaker: Cam
text: Did you get that at Mueller's Antiques?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excitedly_] Well, yes, as a matter of fact, I did.  It represents a great triumph for me.  You see, I snatched it from under the nose of another collector who had actually put a... [_catching himself as he notices Cam's glare_]

speaker: Cora
text: [_rising and running to them_] You were saying, it's a new era of cooperation.  How wonderful.  You should celebrate.  The two of you should go to the symphony tonight.

speaker: Cam
text: But I thought you and I were going.

speaker: Cora
text: I'm going to stay here with Martin.  [_She goes back to sit at the dinner table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose.

speaker: Cora
text: Well, then you'd better hurry.  Cam likes to pre-order his intermission cocktail.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Then you don't have a standing order?  Well, we'd better hurry, then.  We'll take my car.  [_Frasier rushes to the door._]

speaker: Cam
text: I've seen you drive.  We'll take mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, your Humvee?  I think not.

speaker: Cam
text: Not in front of the parents, Crane.  [_Frasier opens the door.  Daphne whizzes by on the Segway, with Niles in pursuit._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Whoo-hoo!

speaker: Niles
text: Darling, darling, darling!  [_Frasier allows them to pass, and then ushers Cam out the door._]

speaker: Martin
text: I can't believe they're going to spend the whole evening together.

speaker: Cora
text: Oh, I know!  If they get through it alive, we should probably tell them the truth.  [_They move to the door._]

speaker: Martin
text: Too bad.  It was fun being your boyfriend for a few days.  [_He opens the door._]

speaker: Cora
text: [_laughing_] It was!  Still, all good things must come to an end.  [_Martin nods.  There is palpable romantic tension.  They lean to each other for an extended and tender kiss._]
